verbs.description: [ARG0: islanders] [V: gather] [ARGM-LOC: in midland beach] [ARGM-PRP: for sixth anniversary of superstorm] [ARGM-ADV: sandy] [ARGM-TMP: six years after superstorm sandy ravaged staten island] dozens of staten islanders gathered at st christopher community center in midland beach for the annual light the shore vigil boy scout pack one led a color guard march from the community center down midland avenue towards midland beach paul konz a den leader for pack one who walked from the community center said the vigil is important because it about remembrance for the people who lost everything in hurricane sandy konz said that while some of the boy scouts walking on monday evening were far too young to remember sandy it important to give back to the community it the least we can do along the sidewalk on midland avenue small electric candles lit the way for those marching through the community that six years before experienced ultimate devastation olena chekmak moved to staten island five years ago but while she was not in staten island during superstorm sandy she said what she has learned about the storm was terrible i think it important to honor those victims and the people who suffered from sandy she said crossing father capodanno boulevard the march met dozens of project hospitality scott lobaido superstorm sandy director karen jackson assemblywoman nicole malliotakis n y paul konz staten islanders staten island midland beach boy scouts max rose rep dan donovan olena chekmak st christopher community center st christophers community center beach father capodanno boulevard

islanders gather in [V: midland] [ARG1: beach] for sixth anniversary of superstorm sandy six years after superstorm sandy ravaged staten island dozens of staten islanders gathered at st christopher community center in midland beach for the annual light the shore vigil boy scout pack one led a color guard march from the community center down midland avenue towards midland beach paul konz a den leader for pack one who walked from the community center said the vigil is important because it about remembrance for the people who lost everything in hurricane sandy konz said that while some of the boy scouts walking on monday evening were far too young to remember sandy it important to give back to the community it the least we can do along the sidewalk on midland avenue small electric candles lit the way for those marching through the community that six years before experienced ultimate devastation olena chekmak moved to staten island five years ago but while she was not in staten island during superstorm sandy she said what she has learned about the storm was terrible i think it important to honor those victims and the people who suffered from sandy she said crossing father capodanno boulevard the march met dozens of project hospitality scott lobaido superstorm sandy director karen jackson assemblywoman nicole malliotakis n y paul konz staten islanders staten island midland beach boy scouts max rose rep dan donovan olena chekmak st christopher community center st christophers community center beach father capodanno boulevard
